# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::AbstractString)
    # Regular expression to match code fences in markdown
    code_fence_pattern = r"^```julia[\r\n]?([^\r\n]*?)```$"m

    # Split the document into lines
    lines = split(md, "\n")

    # Initialize an output string and a counter for code blocks
    out_str = ""
    block_count = 0

    # Iterate over each line in the document
    for (i, line) in enumerate(lines)
        # If the line starts with a code fence
        if occursin(r"^```julia"m, line)
            # Increment the counter and store the content if this is
            # not the first code block
            block_count += 1
            if block_count > 1
                out_str *= "\n"
            end
        elseif block_count == 0
            # If it's not within a code fence, just append to the output
            out_str *= line
        else
            # Append the content of the code block to the output
            content = join(lines[i-block_count+1:i], "\n")
            out_str *= ("\n" * content)
            # Reset the counter if we reach the end of the code block
            if i == length(lines) - 1
                block_count = 0
            end
        end
    end

    return out_str
end
```

This function will take a markdown string `md` and return the combined Julia code blocks, removing the code fences and separating them with newlines.
